formattedAddress: 177 Wadsworth Ave Corner, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 177 Wadsworth Ave Corner, New York, NY 10033-3879, USA

originalText.text: The pizza was  good! I had the square roman style slice but my favorite thing there was the Italian strawberry donut! just wish it had a little more jelly!

text.text: The pizza was  good! I had the square roman style slice but my favorite thing there was the Italian strawberry donut! just wish it had a little more jelly!

originalText.text: The pizza was over all good, thin and chewy, a  simple sauce. The reason for the three stars is the dessert. We got two different cookies both came hard as rocks no way to save them. The lemon blondie is not made in house but a pre packaged dessert, the cake tastes store bought, grandma who home makes cake was in town and was dissapointed the pictures make it all look homemade. We only ordered these things because im expecting fresh homemade like the pizza but they arent . Kinda bummed out about that.  But if your order pizza for sure this is a place to try, dessert not so much.

originalText.text: Ordered a Focaccia Roman style pizza, topped with Tomato sauce, mozzarella, Parmesan, Fresh Basil, Extra Virgin Olive oil. Picked it up as soon as it came out of the oven. It did not have any Parmesan or Extra Virgin Olive oil. Also very little tomato sauce, Mozzarella, basil. Pizza did not taste as good as it looked.

text.text: Ordered a Focaccia Roman style pizza, topped with Tomato sauce, mozzarella, Parmesan, Fresh Basil, Extra Virgin Olive oil. Picked it up as soon as it came out of the oven. It did not have any Parmesan or Extra Virgin Olive oil. Also very little tomato sauce, Mozzarella, basil. Pizza did not taste as good as it looked.

originalText.text: Ordered a margherita pizza tonight for my kids’ dinner and it was delicious! Super fresh, very tasty sauce, crust with just enough chew + salt ratio. We all loved it! I have also stopped by in person for a slice and some desserts. What a great addition to our neighborhood!

text.text: Ordered a margherita pizza tonight for my kids’ dinner and it was delicious! Super fresh, very tasty sauce, crust with just enough chew + salt ratio. We all loved it! I have also stopped by in person for a slice and some desserts. What a great addition to our neighborhood!

originalText.text: As a local in this area, there are only a few places I would highly recommend for pizza in this area and this is definitely one of them! The pizza here is super fluffy and has flavor throughout the crust and I normally don't like to eat the crust. The sauce was light, fresh, and sweet; the tomatoes were just amazing in the margarita pizza! I am all about plain cheese pizza so I would recommend getting the margarita pizza here I found it to have a good amount of cheese and sauce which I love. For me, you can never have enough cheese!  I had the red velvet cake slice here which is honestly the best red velvet hands down I ever tried in the city and I have had some top-rated places, the icing was cream cheese and it was amazing! I am super excited to have this in our neighborhood in Washington Heights and if you are not in the mood for pizza but your partner is you can always grab cheeseburgers and hot dogs next door at Burger heights and eat together in the outside seating! I give this place 5 stars and highly recommend it; the only thing I have not yet tried is the lattes here but I will the next time I visit!
